title: When Aurelion flew over ancient Shurima...
body:
Where he witnessed the construction of Shurima's great Sun Disc. 

Now that it's established their first attempt was actually to build one in Nerimazeth, can you confirm if A.Sol happened to pass over there instead of what we all believed was the capital?

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Whyte Lyon,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=OambWRVN,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-10-05T22:13:44.430+0000)
>
> Where he witnessed the construction of Shurima&#039;s great Sun Disc. 
> 
> Now that it&#039;s established their first attempt was actually to build one in Nerimazeth, can you confirm if A.Sol happened to pass over there instead of what we all believed was the capital?

It was indeed, meant to be the proto-disc at nerimazeth. Glad someone figured out that bit :)

So they figured out how to create Sun Disc by guide of Targonians (Nerimazeth is super close to Targon) and then they made the current Sun Disc by themselves?

Nerimazeth is the most important Shuriman city after the current Shurima Capital. It has a lot history.

* First capital of Shurima.

* First city Sun Disc is made.

* The city built with Chalicar(?).

* The city Xerath was born(?).

* The city darkins burnt to ashes to revenge Fall of Shurima.

* The city Xerath conquered first and made it his new empire's capital.

It has more information than any other shuriman cities.
Don't forget that Twilight of the Gods happened there. It was the city where the "end" of the Darkin began.

Btw, wasn't it said by Aurelion Sol that these "pritimitives" were the most developed of their kind. When Shurima Empire wasn't even built, how can he say they were developed? Even before the empire, did "shurimans" have another country or others just sucked really bad? I mean, it means if Aurelion Sol saw the peak/prime time of Shurima he would be impressed.

Aurelion was talking about Targon, not Shurima. He felt a bit of Celestial magic from Shurima and then talked about how this magic comes from the same place where the premiere civilization is located(Celestial realm).
At least that is how I understood it.

I would say Aurelion Sol is already familiar with Targon, so he would likely just say Targon and not let it ambigious.

And when we look at beneath:

>In a vast stretch of desert, I feel the twinge of familiar magic emanating from the seat of the premiere civilization amongst these savages. Lo and behold, a massive Sun Disc is under construction. The poor enslaved laborers beat their heads and rend their clothes in my wake. Their cruel masters see me, a streaking bolt of fire, as a portent of good omen, no doubt. My passing will be etched in their uncouth pictograms upon common stone, an homage to the great comet, the blessing of the sky-god gracing their holy works and so forth. The Disc’s sole purpose is to funnel the sun’s majesty into the most “renowned” of these fleshy humanoids, transforming them into exactly what this planet needs: more insufferable demigods. This effort will undoubtedly backfire. But I suppose they might last a brief while, perhaps a thousand years or so, before they fall and are supplanted by others.

we clearly see he describes Shurima, with enslaved laborers and many others.

> In a vast stretch of desert, I feel the twinge of familiar magic emanating from the seat of the premiere civilization amongst these savages.

Here he feel the celestial magic of the Sun Disc, as you said, Aurelion is familiar with Targon, thats why he calls the celestial magic familiar. Celestial magic emanate from the celestial realm, where the seat of Targon is located.

I agree that the rest of the quote is about Shurima, but now that I explained it better, can you see why I think that the "premiere civilization" is Targon?
Hmm... You are probably right. When I read it again, he actually might mean Aspects of Targon are there among shurimans. They are guiding them to build Sun Disc.
Nerimazeth is now in dire need of some official art. Your gonna have to be the voice of the people and convince the World Building artists to step to it. xD

Wait hold up, Aurelion flew over Shurima just a short while before star nuking that void infested valley along with the previous pantheon right?

And the events with lissandra and the others were taking place in the Freljord around the same time?

Just how ancient is she? O_O As a mage wouldnt she put Ryze to complete shame just by virtue of sheer experience from age?
I mean, we cant confirm which one it was as far as I know.
